Description: The temptation of St Antony; the saint being beaten and menaced by various devils Pen and brown ink, brown and grey wash, over red chalk
Curator's comments: This is loosely inspired by Callot's etching, the 'Temptation of St Antony' (Lieure 1416; Meaume 139) which includes a similar group of devils beating the saint before the mouth of a cavern with a fire-breathing dragon. An autograph study for this same print is in the BM: 1861,0713.6. The technique of the drawing accords with that sometimes used by Callot and Ternois may well be correct in thinking this is a copy after a lost study. Lit.: D. Ternois, 'Jacques Callot: catalogue complet de son oeuvre dessiné', Paris, 1962, p. 187 (as a copy)
Bibliographic references: Ternois 1962 / Dessins de Jacques Callot, Catalogue complet de son oeuvre dessiné (as copy)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition notes: Acquired from Messrs Colnaghi in exchange for duplicates.
